result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan M Poppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant Logan M Poppe in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Cts 1 and 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2 & 4 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days jail, with Huber.  $443.00 costs.  Ct. 3 $243.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start 2/1/16 at 7:00 pm.  Jail credit 3 days.  Submit DNA sample.

Defendant Logan M Poppe in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Hepler recused himself. New judge to be assigned.  Return date scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
